page.title: 11Villiage schools
page.content:
These are the views expressed by Mrs. Sage during an interview with her.
It was a great pity when the {village school}closed as this meant loss of contact with the{children. They should have kept the school for 5_8 year olds as it is wrong to take very young children out of the village for a whole day.The two{teachers}used to live in the village and this was good. A{Christmas party}is now held for the village{children}each year.
Life is much easier now. In the past I had to gather sticks and logs for fires and lamps needed trimming. I was very pleased when{electricity}became available and the coming of the{T.V. made me feel much less isolated.
